Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi

Class UtilUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi.UtilUnit
  • public final class UtilUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    Internally Mingle only uses Float for numbers.
    Author:
    Francisco José Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

        public static float celsius2fahrenheit​(float celsius)
        Converts a temperature value from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
        Parameters:
        celsius - The temperature in Celsius to be converted.
        Returns:
        The equivalent temperature in Fahrenheit.

        value - The value

        public static int setBetween​(int min,
                             int value,
                             int max)
        Normalizes value making it neither greater than max nor less than min.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum accepted value
        value - Value to normalize
        max - Maximum accepted value
        Returns:
        The normalized value.

                               float value,
                               float max)
        Normaliza value haciendo que no sea mayor que max ni menor que min.
        Parameters:

        value - Valor a normalizar
        max - Máximo valor aceptado
        Returns:
        El valor normalizado.

      • percent2abs

        public static int percent2abs​(int percent,
                              int min,
                              int max)
        Converts a percentage to an absolute value within a specified range. For example, 50% of a range between 0 and 255 is 127: 
            percent2abs(50, 0, 255) == 127
        Parameters:
        percent - The percentage value (0 to 100).
        min - The minimum value of the range.
        max - The maximum value of the range.
        Returns:
        The absolute value corresponding to the percentage within the range.

      • percent2abs

        public static float percent2abs​(float percent,
                                float min,
                                float max)
        Converts a percentage to an absolute value within a specified range. For example, 50% of a range between 0 and 255 is 127: 
            percent2abs(50, 0, 255) == 127
        Parameters:
        percent - The percentage value (0 to 100).
        min - The minimum value of the range.
        max - The maximum value of the range.
        Returns:
        The absolute value corresponding to the percentage within the range.

      • abs2percent

        public static int abs2percent​(int abs,
                              int min,
                              int max)
        Converts an absolute value within a specified range to a percentage. For example, 127 in a range between 0 and 255 is 50%: 
            abs2percent(127, 0, 255) == 50
        Parameters:
        abs - The absolute value within the range [min, max].
        min - The minimum value of the range.
        max - The maximum value of the range.
        Returns:
        The percentage corresponding to the absolute value within the range.

      • abs2percent

        public static float abs2percent​(float abs,
                                float min,
                                float max)
        Converts an absolute value within a specified range to a percentage. For example, 127 in a range between 0 and 255 is 50%: 
            abs2percent(127, 0, 255) == 50
        Parameters:
        abs - The absolute value within the range [min, max].
        min - The minimum value of the range.
        max - The maximum value of the range.
        Returns:
        The percentage corresponding to the absolute value within the range.

      • toMillis

        public static long toMillis​(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns the number of milliseconds that corresponds to received argument.
        • If String, it can comes with or without unit suffix.
        • If number, can be integer or decimal.
        Parameters:
        o -
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds that corresponds to received argument.
